metadata.title: Events - HTTP API
metadata.description:
The /event endpoints fire new events and to query the available events in
Consul.

blocking queries provide a monotonic index and block until a newer index is
available. This can be supported as a consequence of the total ordering of the
`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/consul/docs/concept/consensus"},`consensus protocol`),`. With gossip, there is no
ordering, and instead `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`X-Consul-Index`),` maps to the newest event that matches the
query.`),mdx("p",null,`In practice, this means the index is only useful when used against a single
agent and has no meaning globally. Because Consul defines the index as being
opaque, clients should not be expecting a natural ordering either.`))};MDXContent.isMDXComponent=true;

metadata.title: Consul by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Consul is a service networking solution to automate network configurations, discover services, and enable secure connectivity across any cloud or runtime.
